Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: フランツ
Entry.EnglishText: Frantz

Entry.JapaneseText: 馬車屋
Entry.EnglishText: Carriage Coach

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: イゴル
Entry.EnglishText: Igor

Entry.JapaneseText: マヤ
Entry.EnglishText: Maya

Entry.JapaneseText: おじいさん
Entry.EnglishText: Old Man

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエン
Entry.EnglishText: Kyogen

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエン
Entry.EnglishText: Kyogen

Entry.JapaneseText: ここがキョグエンか……
Entry.EnglishText: So this is Kyogen...

Entry.JapaneseText: すごいキレイな街だよネ！ こんな建物、見たコトないヨ。
Entry.EnglishText: It sure is pretty! I've never seen buildings like these before.

Entry.JapaneseText: ここは小さな街だが、美しい 景色を目当てに訪れる人も多い。 これまでに大きな争いもなく、 とても落ち着いた街だ。
Entry.EnglishText: It may be a small village, but its idyllic scenery has made it a popular tourist destination. It's a rather tranquil town that has, so far, been free of conflict.

Entry.JapaneseText: けっこうけっこう。 <Cyan>雲海にそびえし古の塔<White>の話も、 ここならすぐに聞けそうだな。 行こうぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: Sweeeet! Finding out about the <Cyan>ancient tower that soars above a sea of clouds<White> is going to be a breeze. Let's go.

Entry.JapaneseText: フランツさん!!
Entry.EnglishText: Frantz!

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、キミたち、どこに行ってたんだ!? 今、盗賊たちが<Claire>さんを 連れて行ったぞ!! あっちだ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, where have you guys been?! Some bandits just ran off with Claire! They went that way!

Entry.JapaneseText: クルルルゥ……
Entry.EnglishText: Coo... Coo...

Entry.JapaneseText: 申し訳ありません。 馬車は運休となっております。
Entry.EnglishText: We're truly sorry, but carriages are not available for use at the moment.

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>お金が足りないようですね。 馬車のご利用料金は <nmb:12C>ガルドになります。
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000000>You seem to be short on money. The fee for using the carriage is <nmb:12C> Gald.

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>馬車をご利用になりますか？ 料金は定額で<nmb:12C>ガルドになります。
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000000>Would you like to use a carriage? The fare is a flat rate of <nmb:12C> Gald.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>馬車を利用しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Travel by Carriage? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: スールズ
Entry.EnglishText: Sulz

Entry.JapaneseText: ミナール
Entry.EnglishText: Minal

Entry.JapaneseText: ペトナジャンカ
Entry.EnglishText: Petnadjanka

Entry.JapaneseText: サニイタウン
Entry.EnglishText: Sunnytown

Entry.JapaneseText: アニカマル
Entry.EnglishText: Anikamal

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd

Entry.JapaneseText: 馬車に乗らない
Entry.EnglishText: Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダ
Entry.EnglishText: Razilda

Entry.JapaneseText: ピピスタ
Entry.EnglishText: Pipista

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエン
Entry.EnglishText: Kyogen

Entry.JapaneseText: ノルゼン
Entry.EnglishText: Nolzen

Entry.JapaneseText: モクラド
Entry.EnglishText: Mocrado

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>馬車で<unk18:48E00428B8048880>に移動します。 料金<nmb:12C>ガルド はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>The fare to <unk18:48E00428B8048880>is <nmb:12C> Gald. Embark Stay

Entry.JapaneseText: よぉ、あんたらか。 ひさしぶりだな。
Entry.EnglishText: Hello, long time no see.

Entry.JapaneseText: イゴル！ 会えてよかった…… あんたに頼みたい事がある。
Entry.EnglishText: Igor! It's so good to see you... There's something I want to ask of you.
Entry.Notes: 会えてよかった…… reads more "relief" than just blunt good to see you

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺に？ 一体、なんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: Of me? What do you need?

Entry.JapaneseText: 鎮魂錠が必要なんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: We need a Requiem Pastille.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鎮魂錠？ ああ、あるぜ。 ラジルダから逃げる時、 かろうじて持ち出したヤツがな。
Entry.EnglishText: You need a Requiem Pastille? Yeah, I have some. I was able to take some with me when I escaped Razilda.

Entry.JapaneseText: 分けてもらえないか？
Entry.EnglishText: Could you share one with us?

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、いいぜ。 ホラ、持って行きな。
Entry.EnglishText: Sure. Here you go.

Entry.JapaneseText: すまない。
Entry.EnglishText: Sorry for the trouble.

Entry.JapaneseText: 気にしなさんな。 他でもない、あんたたちのためだ。 さあ、行きな。急ぐんだろ？
Entry.EnglishText: Don't worry about it. I'd help you with just about anything. You're in a hurry, right? Better get a move on.

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、ありがとう！
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah. Thanks!

Entry.JapaneseText: あんな災害でも生き残ったんだ。 生きてるだけで儲けもんだよな。
Entry.EnglishText: Managing to survive through that disaster is a blessing on its own.

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダが海に沈んでから、 生き残った連中は抜け殻みたいに なっちまった。
Entry.EnglishText: Those who managed to survive Razilda's sinking seem like shells of who they once were.

Entry.JapaneseText: 故郷が一瞬でなくなっちまったんだ。 これから自分はどうやって生きていけば いいのかが、わからなくなってるんだな。
Entry.EnglishText: When your home vanishes in an instant, it's hard to know what to do or how to keep on living.

Entry.JapaneseText: 今はまだ、どうする事もできねえが、 みんなが希望を持てるような事を 考えてみるつもりさ。
Entry.EnglishText: I might not be able to do anything yet, but I'm trying to think of a way to restore everyone's hope.

Entry.JapaneseText: 親父は収容所だし、 俺がしっかりしないとな。
Entry.EnglishText: My father is in prison, so I need to step up.

Entry.JapaneseText: 生き延びたヤツを集めて、 いつか新しいラジルダを 作るつもりさ。
Entry.EnglishText: I plan on gathering the survivors of Razilda and rebuilding the city.

Entry.JapaneseText: 盗賊は街の東の方へと逃げた！ 早くしないとクレアさんが……！
Entry.EnglishText: Those thieves ran to the east! You need to hurry to save Claire...!

Entry.JapaneseText: 小屋？ 確か……街の西側に 小さな小屋があったと思うが…… そこにクレアさんが……!?
Entry.EnglishText: A hostel? I believe there was one to the west of the city... Is that where they took Claire?!

Entry.JapaneseText: 色々と嫌な事のあった街ですが、 やっぱり故郷が忘れられません。
Entry.EnglishText: Even though there was a lot wrong with it, I will never be able to forget my hometown.

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダに…… 帰りたい……
Entry.EnglishText: I want to go back to Razilda...

Entry.JapaneseText: 一緒に逃げてきたイゴルさんは ピピスタに行っちゃいました。 もっとガジュマの事を知りたいって……
Entry.EnglishText: I escaped with Igor, but he's gone to Pipista. He said he wanted to know more about Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとヒューマ、ふたつの関係を 新しいものにするために…… 私にも何かできないかしら……？
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder if there's anything I can do to help form a new relationship between Huma and Gajuma...?

Entry.JapaneseText: クレア！ まさか、こんなところで あなたと会うなんて……
Entry.EnglishText: Claire! I never thought I'd see you here.

Entry.JapaneseText: 故郷のラジルダがなくなって あてもなくキョグエンにきたら、 ファムと会って……
Entry.EnglishText: I had no idea what I was going to do here after Razilda was destroyed, but then I met with Pham.

Entry.JapaneseText: マヤさえよければ、しばらく 一緒に暮らさないかって 言ってくれたの。
Entry.EnglishText: She asked me if I wanted to stay with her for the time being.

Entry.JapaneseText: さらわれた時は自分の運の悪さを少しうらんだりしたけど、
Entry.EnglishText: When I was kidnapped, I felt so down on my luck...
Entry.Notes: more accurate is that she cursed her own bad luck

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたやファムと出会えて 本当に良かったって…… 今はそう思うわ……
Entry.EnglishText: But thanks to that, I got to meet you and Pham... I'm really grateful...

Entry.JapaneseText: 今はファムの仕事を手伝ってるの。 雑貨屋のほうにいるはずだから あの子にも会ってあげてね。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm currently helping Pham with her job. She should be by the item shop, so you should stop by to say hello.

Entry.JapaneseText: 聞いたところによると、 他の街では種族の対立が 激しいらしいのう。
Entry.EnglishText: I've heard that the racial conflicts in other towns have been growing more intense.

Entry.JapaneseText: ここは対立はないんじゃ。 皆、お金もあって、 心が豊かだからのう……
Entry.EnglishText: We have none of that here. Everyone here is both abundant in money and peace of mind...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Cyan>幻の庭<White>を探しておる人？ さあ、心当たりはないが……
Entry.EnglishText: You're searching for a person who knows of the <Cyan>Garden of Illusions<White>? Hm... I wouldn't know anyone...

Entry.JapaneseText: お金を払えば、誰かが 教えてくれるかもしれんよ。 のほほほ……
Entry.EnglishText: Perhaps if you were to offer money for that information, someone would be willing to tell you... Ohoho...

Entry.JapaneseText: ワン・ギン様は それはそれは大金持ちじゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: Lord Wang Gin is quite the wealthy individual.

Entry.JapaneseText: あの人に買えないものは この世にはないと言われとる。 のほほほ……
Entry.EnglishText: They say that there is nothing in this world he cannot buy. Ohoho...

Entry.JapaneseText: 買えないものがないだと？ 愛が金で買えるもんかよ！
Entry.EnglishText: "Nothing," you say?! You can't buy LOVE with money!

Entry.JapaneseText: のほほほ…… 青い、青いのう……
Entry.EnglishText: Ohoho... How naive...

Entry.JapaneseText: じゃあ、純粋なヒトの身体も 手に入るって言うの？
Entry.EnglishText: Do you think he'd also be able to purchase the body of a pure Human being?

Entry.JapaneseText: はぁ……何の事やらわからんが、 ワン・ギン様に聞いてみたら どうじゃ？
Entry.EnglishText: Erm... I have no clue what you're talking about. Perhaps you should go ask him yourself?

Entry.JapaneseText: 命は……命はお金じゃ 手に入りませんよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Life... Life isn't something that can be bought...

Entry.JapaneseText: そうかのう……？ のほほほ……
Entry.EnglishText: Is that so...? Ohoho...

Entry.JapaneseText: オークションが 始まるそうじゃな…… のほほほ……
Entry.EnglishText: It appears that the auction is starting... Ohohoho...

Entry.JapaneseText: 今回はどんなものが 出品されるのか…… 楽しみだわい。
Entry.EnglishText: I can't wait to see what they'll put up this time...

Entry.JapaneseText: 盗賊が来たみたいだが、 まあ、またそのうち軍隊が来て 守ってくれるわい。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems that some bandits have come by, but soon the army will be here to protect us.

Entry.JapaneseText: 軍には、たんまりと協力費を 収めておるんじゃからのう…… のほほほ……
Entry.EnglishText: We pay those folks a lot for the work they do... Ohohoh...

Entry.JapaneseText: 盗賊ってのも、かわいそうなものじゃ。 お金さえあれば、あんな事を 必死にせずに済むのにのう……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, those thieves sure are pitiful. If only they had money, then they wouldn't have to resort to such deeds...

Entry.JapaneseText: 働けばいいんじゃ…… 私は、働かなくともお金が入って 来るがね……のほほほ……
Entry.EnglishText: They should just find work... As for me, I don't have to lift a finger to rake in the cash... Ohoho...

Entry.JapaneseText: ひげの冒険家さんも、 何が楽しくて、あのような 金にならん事をしとるのか……
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder how that bearded adventurer has so much fun doing something that makes him no money...

Entry.JapaneseText: いやなに、幻なんたらを探すと、 北の方へ行ったんじゃ。 金のない者の気持ちはわからん…… のほほほ……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, well you see, he headed north in search of some sort of illusion. I can't tell what goes through the minds of those without money... Ohoho...

Entry.JapaneseText: アガーテ様がベルサスで お話をされたとか…… のほほほ……
Entry.EnglishText: I heard Queen Agarte gave a speech in Belsas... Ohoho...

Entry.JapaneseText: ここにいらして、もう一度、 お話をしていただきたいもんじゃ。 もちろん、お金は払うとも……
Entry.EnglishText: I hope she would give one here too. I would pay good money to see it...

Entry.JapaneseText: 争いごとを収めておる？ この街は争いがどうのというのは そうないしの。
Entry.EnglishText: You're looking to quell conflicts? We have no such thing in this town.

Entry.JapaneseText: ミナールはどうじゃの？ 最近、色々大変だと言う話じゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: Why not head to Minal? I keep hearing about dreadful things happening there lately.

Entry.JapaneseText: ま、争いを止めたところで、 誰も金はくれんと思うがの。 のほほほ……
Entry.EnglishText: Though I guess there's no money in stopping people from fighting. Ohoho...

Entry.JapaneseText: このうっとうしい音を止めてくれたら 好きなだけお金をあげるわい。
Entry.EnglishText: I'll give you all the money you want if you could put a stop to this horrid sound.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんとかしてくれんかね？ とほ……とほほほ……
Entry.EnglishText: Can you please do something? Hoho... Hohoho...

Entry.JapaneseText: 他の街の人たちはケンカばかり しておるそうじゃが…… お金がないからそうなる……
Entry.EnglishText: People from other towns are constantly fighting. I suppose that's inevitable given their economic status...

Entry.JapaneseText: お金さえあれば、何でも手に入る。 平和も、安全も、時には愛も…… お金は大事じゃ……のほほほ……
Entry.EnglishText: You can have anything as long as you have enough money for it. Be it peace, security, or even love. Money is important, after all... Ohoho...

Entry.JapaneseText: お、お金ならいくらでも払うぞ…… だからバイラスから守っておくれ！ お願いじゃよ……！
Entry.EnglishText: P-Please! If it's money you want, I'll give you all I have! Just save me from those Biruses...!

Entry.JapaneseText: この街には争いがない…… お金があるからじゃ。 のほほほ……
Entry.EnglishText: This town has no conflict... Everyone here is wealthy, after all... Ohohoho...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたは…… あまりお金持ちでは なさそうじゃな……
Entry.EnglishText: You folks don't seem that wealthy...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうも、わざわざありがとう。 今回も、すばらしい品を 期待してますよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you for taking the trouble to come get me. I look forward to seeing all the splendid things they're putting up for auction.

Entry.JapaneseText: ミナールから来た客
Entry.EnglishText: Minal's Visitor

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No
